artefact.overview: You must tell DVLA if you have arthritis and use special controls for driving - download the correct form to let them know
artefact.body:
You only need to tell DVLA if you have arthritis and you use special controls for driving.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA if you use special controls for driving. Fill in form G1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘Form G1’ (PDF, 283KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA if you use special controls for driving. Fill in form G1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘Form G1V’ (PDF, 318KB)
